column4: The dialup works fine in windows, but I really want to go to ubuntu. This is proving to be an impossible limitation.
Just in case anyone is confused. I am NOT on AOL, normal PAP isp.
if dialup works in windows, it will work in ubuntu
sound great in theory. not happening in practice
I jumped int late so, can I help
I get errors in /var/log/messages and modem hangs up.
did you use pppconfig to enable ppp?
paste in pastebin.com lspci
what is pastebin.com?
it
without annoying the other people on this channel
sorry ubuntu system just crashed. restarting now and will post in pastebin "lspci -vv" under name JE55E
after you paste it there will be an address yo can give me
heres the problem in pastebin http://pastebin.com/286819
let me know if that works. and I will next paste the hardware
I'll be honest, I've never seen that sequence.
my isp is iiNet in Australia. However, I have also tried connecting to a windows RAS server, and get the exact same error
ok, this is a bit bigger than I can chew, pppconfig has never failed me, (US), so, hang in there, ask again.
heres the lspci in pastebin http://pastebin.com/286828
I'm reading your log as a modem that is actually working, and the lspci was to look for a winmodem that doesn't. Like I said, ask for more competent help
Thanks for trying :-/
I shoot for 60%
